Articles.Content:
I'm having a very strange issue. When I put batteries on my rockets the game crashes. It runs fine in the editor, but when I'm going to the launche pad it crashes. When I remove the batteries it works. No crash.

I have some mods installed and I'm running the game with OpenGL and Active Texture Management to save memory.

http://imgur.com/GJaJoQM

These are the mods in the order I installed them. I'm currently removing mods to see if it's a single one causing the problem.

Active Texture Management (aggresive version)

Alternate Resource Panel

Ambient Light Adjustment

Distant Object Enhancement

Chatterer

Deadly Reentry

Docking Port Alignment Indicator

Ferram Aerospace Research

Final Frontier

Karbonite

Karbonite Plus

Warp Drive

Regolith

Kerbal Alarm Clock

Kerbal Attachment System

Kerbal Engineer

Kerbal Joint Reinforcement

Kronal Vessel Viewer

MechJeb

DMagic Orbital Science

Quick Scroll

Quick Search

Filter Extension

Procedural Fairings

Raster Prop Monitor

SCANsat

TAC Life Support

Transfer Window Planner

Tweakable Everything

Toolbar

Precise Node

Remote Tech

Community Resource Pack

Ven Stock Revamp

Hyper Edit

RLA Stockalike

Adjustable Landing Gear

Crowd Sourced Science

Fusebox

Hot Rockets

FASA Launch Clamps and Tower

Science Alert

Kerbal NRAP

Ship Manifest

Planet Shine

RTG Generator

Outer Planets Mod

Environmental Visual Enhancements

Texture Replacer

Universal Storage

My best guess is, that a mod is messing with the battery parts in a way that make the game crash. But I could not yet figure out which one.

Edit: I'm running the 32bit version and constantly monitoring my ram. The game is nowhere near the magical 3.5gb.

Edited February 17, 2015 by Theylok

It seems I fixed it. Apperently Texture Replacer caused the crash. Also after that I installed some other mods and KspPlayers and S.A.V.E. crashed the game again. But it seems to be stable now.

But I'm still confused to why the game only crashed when there was a battery on the rocket.

Good to see you fixed it.

I was going to say that you may be using bad Duracell batteries. Those don't work well :3
